node.doctext:
What follows below is the edited log from the first Online Gods/Editors Meeting which took place on 18 August 2007 at 19h00 GMT. It's edited for length - I have removed various comings and goings, and other IRC administrivia, and fixed typos, but that's it. The raw log will remain available, at request to me.

At the conclusion of the log, I've summarized the ACTIONS agreed upon and they're listed for easy reference.

(2007-08-18 13:58:19) =-= dann has changed the topic to “1) Fit and function of IRC for our discussion medium; 2) The theme quest publicity; 3) Terms of service; 4) Timing of and technology for next meeting; 5) Forum for issues with users”

(2007-08-18 14:00:45) <dann> This is more or less a test-run meeting, to wrap up a few things from previous conversations, and see if IRC works well for us, collaboration-wise.

(2007-08-18 14:01:07) <spiregrain> I move dann chairs this thing

(2007-08-18 14:01:15) <AndrewAguecheek> seconded

(2007-08-18 14:01:16) <Wiccanpiper> seconded!

(2007-08-18 14:01:17) <DEB> Seconded.

(2007-08-18 14:01:18) <dann> We only have five things to discuss this go-around, all of which are in the topic.

(2007-08-18 14:01:20) <dann> *smiles*

(2007-08-18 14:01:34) <spiregrain> let's go to 1)

(2007-08-18 14:01:55) <Two_Sheds> It sounds like 1 and 4 are closely related. Could we do them together?

(2007-08-18 14:02:00) <spiregrain> How many of us are IRC first timers?

(2007-08-18 14:02:02) <dann> I'd imagine so.

(2007-08-18 14:02:04) <Wiccanpiper> so moved!

(2007-08-18 14:02:10) <eien_meru> seconded.

(2007-08-18 14:02:15) <DEB> I'm an IRC newb.

(2007-08-18 14:02:23) <Dimview> I am new too

(2007-08-18 14:02:29) * Gorgonzola used IRC once several years ago, but didn't like the mIRC licensing agreement

(2007-08-18 14:02:31) <spiregrain> of the IRC newbs, are you using one of the web interfaces?

(2007-08-18 14:02:37) <XWiz> I've not used IRC before. I'm using a program called 'Linkinus'.

(2007-08-18 14:02:46) <Dimview> ChatZilla

(2007-08-18 14:02:48) <Gorgonzola> Good thing there are Web interfaces for me to use now.

(2007-08-18 14:02:58) <Wiccanpiper> Other than Yahoo!, I investigated Meebo, which has a browser front end, but didn't get very far past creating an account and trying it out.

(2007-08-18 14:03:00) <DEB> ChatZilla also.

(2007-08-18 14:03:00) <dann> for those of you who are new (or re-newed) to IRC, was it too difficult to setup, or will it be a challenge to get going again later?

(2007-08-18 14:03:06) * Gorgonzola is using the client on SlashNET directly

(2007-08-18 14:03:26) <XWiz> Very easy to set up; no problems. There's also a pretty good node on ICQ that helped.

(2007-08-18 14:03:31) <Dimview> Easy and einfach.

(2007-08-18 14:03:38) * spiregrain checks e2 to see if anyone is having probs with it

(2007-08-18 14:03:39) * XWiz means IRC.

(2007-08-18 14:03:43) <Wiccanpiper> I found Chatzilla very easy to install into Firefox and use, and www.mirc.com has a nice list of commands.

(2007-08-18 14:03:45) <Gorgonzola> It was a (forehead intall)

(2007-08-18 14:03:53) <DEB> I was almost reduced to tears, but not quite. Considering that I live 2000 years ago, it can't be bad going.

(2007-08-18 14:03:55) <Gorgonzola> ERm, Foreheal install.

(2007-08-18 14:04:03) <cletus> Mac users: I'm on Colloquy, which is also handy

(2007-08-18 14:04:10) <LordBrawl> I was vaguely put off by the website name, but once I'd assured myself it was legit, no issues w/ setup

(2007-08-18 14:04:14) * eien_meru uses Colloquy as well.

(2007-08-18 14:04:23) * AndrewAguecheek users mIRC

(2007-08-18 14:04:26) <spiregrain> LB - what website name is that?

(2007-08-18 14:04:28) * AndrewAguecheek uses*

(2007-08-18 14:04:31) <LordBrawl> "hacksrus.com"

(2007-08-18 14:04:50) <LordBrawl> (Home of chatzilla)

(2007-08-18 14:05:04) <spiregrain> hahaha

(2007-08-18 14:05:10) <dann> will it be a good idea for one of us to put together a document on the staff side of things describing how to setup at least one good IRC client on each of the four major platforms? (win, lin, osx, web)

(2007-08-18 14:05:18) <spiregrain> dann - yes

(2007-08-18 14:05:24) <DEB> Yes, I think so.

(2007-08-18 14:05:25) <Wiccanpiper> I nominate spiregrain!

(2007-08-18 14:05:26) <Gorgonzola> Right there is the principal drawback: The short idle-out time.

(2007-08-18 14:05:28) <Dimview> Definitely

(2007-08-18 14:05:44) <spiregrain> I can only speak for Linux and Web

(2007-08-18 14:06:00) <spiregrain> but will type something up on those two and the generics tomorrow

(2007-08-18 14:06:09) <dann> it seems like we've got 13 out of 52 active folks on staff here. it's very good for a first-run - thanks for all of your efforts to make it in!

(2007-08-18 14:06:14) <Wiccanpiper> The best for Windows is still mIRC, I think, I can help with that one, spire.

(2007-08-18 14:06:16) <spiregrain> what IRC setup are you using?

(2007-08-18 14:06:28) <spiregrain> anthropod- what IRC setup are you using?

(2007-08-18 14:06:34) <dann> ok - I'll put the IRC doc on "the list" if anyone wants to take action on it, message me and we'll work it through

(2007-08-18 14:06:48) <Dimview> I've been hanging for hours without being time outed

(2007-08-18 14:07:08) <Gorgonzola> I think it depends on where you're connecting from.

(2007-08-18 14:07:37) <Gorgonzola> Plus.com dropped my connection after a very short time idle.

(2007-08-18 14:07:46) <spiregrain> Plus.com is mine

(2007-08-18 14:07:46) <dann> second on the agenda is the theme quest, and how to get news of it "out there"

(2007-08-18 14:08:04) <spiregrain> Plus.com might be therefore be bollloxed

(2007-08-18 14:08:21) <eien_meru> Well, it's been frontpaged.

(2007-08-18 14:08:26) <LordBrawl> Out where, dann?

(2007-08-18 14:08:32) <dann> we've managed to get MSU to offer $250 for the winner of the quest, as decided by the userbase

(2007-08-18 14:08:36) <cletus> what if we changed the default theme to some contender every couple of days?

(2007-08-18 14:08:36) <LordBrawl> Out beyond "regular e2" ?

(2007-08-18 14:08:38) <Wiccanpiper> We could all stick it on our homenodes . . .

(2007-08-18 14:08:39) <eien_meru> I think the main issue with having the design quest is that the site's structure hasn't solidified yet.

(2007-08-18 14:08:40) =-= spiregrain has changed the topic to "1) Fit and function of IRC for our discussion medium; ** 2) The theme quest publicity; ** 3) Terms of service; 4) Timing of and technology for next meeting; 5) Forum for issues with users"

(2007-08-18 14:08:57) <eien_meru> I mean, people are still playing with what elements are tagged by what names and IDs, and so on.

(2007-08-18 14:09:02) <dann> the issue is, so far as I know, that we don't have many entrants. My take on it may be a few days stale, though

(2007-08-18 14:09:19) <dann> Two_Sheds: how many folks do you estimate are participating?

(2007-08-18 14:09:22) <DEB> How many entrants do we have?

(2007-08-18 14:09:28) <LordBrawl> My recent experience with my quest it that you need to keep hammerin', and you need people to see progress

(2007-08-18 14:09:38) <spiregrain> I consider myself quite techie, but I've got no idea how to do CSS and no time/inclination to learn

(2007-08-18 14:09:51) <spiregrain> there is a barrier to entry that will limit the number of participants

(2007-08-18 14:10:01) <DEB> I certainly don't have the foggiest idea about it.

(2007-08-18 14:10:06) <Two_Sheds> Whoa, my connection was broken for awhile.

(2007-08-18 14:10:08) <Gorgonzola> Designing a whole new theme is a big undertaking

(2007-08-18 14:10:09) <LordBrawl> And with something so visual, we may need images.

(2007-08-18 14:10:33) <Gorgonzola> Much more so than a regular quest, where a really good writeup can be made in a few hours

(2007-08-18 14:10:35) <LordBrawl> Maybe everyone who participates should get into "users with image" so they can post a screen shot on their h/n?

(2007-08-18 14:10:49) <Gorgonzola> I like that

(2007-08-18 14:10:53) <XWiz> Homenode images don't really work reliably enough for that, do they?

(2007-08-18 14:10:55) <dann> that would make a good bit of sense, yes

(2007-08-18 14:10:57) <Dimview> Good one. LB

(2007-08-18 14:10:58) <LordBrawl> And we could have a master list with a "new and cool"

(2007-08-18 14:11:01) <cletus> screen shots, yes

(2007-08-18 14:11:16) <eien_meru> XWiz: At one time [Excalibre] was using his homenode image in such a manner.

(2007-08-18 14:11:22) <dann> this is true - you typically have to resubmit them four to ten times to get them to stick on every server

(2007-08-18 14:11:27) <spiregrain> maybe we should put some screen grabs of the new themes onto the quest announcement.

(2007-08-18 14:11:49) <LordBrawl> Yes, something great and maybe somethin' awful

(2007-08-18 14:11:51) <spiregrain> dann - can that be fixed?

(2007-08-18 14:11:55) <cletus> a consolidated list of contenders + images

(2007-08-18 14:11:58) <LordBrawl> "this could be the theme unless YOU help us"

(2007-08-18 14:12:07) <eien_meru> heh

(2007-08-18 14:12:21) <anthropod2> Maybe I'm actually in now?

(2007-08-18 14:12:25) <AndrewAguecheek> hah, do we need someone to design a very nasty theme then?

(2007-08-18 14:12:27) <anthropod2> I am! I can speak.

(2007-08-18 14:12:28) <dann> spire: indeed it can. the quest node is a doc, so it's not as HTML-filtered as some of the rest of our nodetypes

(2007-08-18 14:12:28) <Two_Sheds> I think the site's structure has solidified. We're happy to add ids and classes, but it's definitely style-able now, and I don't think anything done now will break later.

(2007-08-18 14:12:35) <LordBrawl> I got my latest user image to stabilize by just reloading and checking until all the servers synch'd up

(2007-08-18 14:12:36) <Wiccanpiper> Hi Anthro, you are indeed!

(2007-08-18 14:12:47) <anthropod2> whew

(2007-08-18 14:12:50) <cletus> hi anthro

(2007-08-18 14:12:58) <spiregrain> the themes are here: [http://www.everything2.com/index.pl? node_id=1854411&lastnode_id=1901628]

(2007-08-18 14:13:00) <anthropod2> This is hard for the old folks.

(2007-08-18 14:13:16) <spiregrain> anthropod - what are you using? Plus.com?

(2007-08-18 14:13:33) <anthropod2> I'm on slashnet now.

(2007-08-18 14:13:44) <spiregrain> might actually work then

(2007-08-18 14:14:09) <Two_Sheds> I've been trying to create a list of contenders, but the only person who sent me his entries still needs to work on them a bit. There's one theme so far that I think is really good, and that user hasn't submitted.

(2007-08-18 14:14:12) <LordBrawl> DO we want to attract designers who aren't e2 users?

(2007-08-18 14:14:13) <spiregrain> which usergroups are likely to have CSS fiends in them?

(2007-08-18 14:14:13) <Two_Sheds> I'll ask him to, though.

(2007-08-18 14:14:22) <XWiz> Which theme?

(2007-08-18 14:14:27) <LordBrawl> Or do we want it to come from within?

(2007-08-18 14:15:07) <dann> LordBrawl: I think the plan is to offer the reward predominantly to the userbase. If we want outside designers, we could probably get them, though

(2007-08-18 14:15:10) <AndrewAguecheek> LB does it matter if it's not from within?

(2007-08-18 14:15:42) <spiregrain> someone from without, who wanted to do any sort of testing would have to join up anyway

(2007-08-18 14:15:42) <dann> I know we initially discussed having [CmdrTaco|Malda]'s wife work on the design, as well as a few other design houses

(2007-08-18 14:15:45) <Gorgonzola> It's not as if it takes more than 5 minutes to create an E2 user account.

(2007-08-18 14:16:01) <AndrewAguecheek> - if the user base wants a homegrown design they'd vote for it on that basis wouldn't they

(2007-08-18 14:16:04) <cletus> i think anyone who made a proper skin for e2 would be welcomed as a member of the community pretty quick

(2007-08-18 14:16:10) <dann> I'd certainly rather focus on internal submissions, but wouldn't want to rule external ones out entirely -- so long as we can pull them into the fold, so to speak

(2007-08-18 14:16:17) <LordBrawl> Just that if we want to promote it in design communities outside e2, that's a horse of a different colo(u)r

(2007-08-18 14:16:57) <DEB> It perhaps only matters to the extent that users understand what is required and probably have a firmer grasp of that.

(2007-08-18 14:17:09) <LordBrawl> Can all users see and use [The Catwalk]?

(2007-08-18 14:17:12) <dann> this is also true - if we want design communities to participate, I think we'll have to have much more rigid rules than "make it look good - be experimental, and have fun!"

(2007-08-18 14:17:15) <eien_meru> LB: yes

(2007-08-18 14:17:19) <Gorgonzola> No idea

(2007-08-18 14:17:21) <Two_Sheds_2> Yes, everyone can use [The Catwalk].

(2007-08-18 14:17:30) <eien_meru> It doesn't even have a level restriction.

(2007-08-18 14:18:14) <spiregrain> I think people know about the compo, you can't really do more than put it on the front page

(2007-08-18 14:18:25) <cletus> what kinds of rules would an outside designer have to know?

(2007-08-18 14:18:32) <AndrewAguecheek> Will we really need more rules - what could happen if we didn't?

(2007-08-18 14:18:34) <spiregrain> the trouble is that the people with the skills, time and inclination to compete are fewer and further between

(2007-08-18 14:18:34) <DEB> If we were to invite outside agencies (for want of a better term), I think that we'd have to have some sort of clear design brief.

(2007-08-18 14:18:36) <Two_Sheds_2> I think providing some examples would help. I'll add my theme as one for starters.

(2007-08-18 14:18:40) <XWiz> It's a least a page down on the front page for me, though - can we get it nearer the top?

(2007-08-18 14:18:44) <LordBrawl> We haven't promoted [The Catwalk] directly though

(2007-08-18 14:18:59) <Wiccanpiper> I looked at [The Catwalk] and had a bit of fun with it.

(2007-08-18 14:19:05) <spiregrain> people form the outside should be invited to let their imagination run wild

(2007-08-18 14:19:06) <anthropod2> Yeah I never heard of [The Catwalk] before. It's cool.

(2007-08-18 14:19:17) <Two_Sheds_2> I think it would be tricky for an outsider to know what all the widgets they're styling are supposed to do.

(2007-08-18 14:19:23) <spiregrain> we've all spent the last several years staring at the same old layout

(2007-08-18 14:19:24) <LordBrawl> I can't even see it with a quick glance at "[Make E2 Pretty]"

(2007-08-18 14:19:35) <AndrewAguecheek> If people from the outside do something wrong, then are we under any mandate to accept their entry?

(2007-08-18 14:19:48) <Two_Sheds_2> We can add a link to [The Catwalk] to the front page announcement.

(2007-08-18 14:19:51) <dann> that's something good to add to the announcement node, then - a link to [The Catwalk]

(2007-08-18 14:19:51) <spiregrain> outsides will have a fresh perspective

(2007-08-18 14:20:21) <spiregrain> It'd be great if [The Catwalk] have preview pics

(2007-08-18 14:20:21) <dann> was [montana] a regular user before putting together our Jukka theme?

(2007-08-18 14:20:30) <spiregrain> it's a bit Mystery Meat at the moment

(2007-08-18 14:20:36) <dann> Two_Sheds_2: can we re-factor [The Catwalk] to include previews?

(2007-08-18 14:20:37) <eien_meru> It's not like E2 fundamentally changes any of the theory of graphic design. Outsiders would be just fine.

(2007-08-18 14:20:48) <Wiccanpiper> Just as long as outsiders don't feel the need to put a silly face as part of the theme, as so many web sites do!

(2007-08-18 14:21:11) <eien_meru> Wiccanpiper: ooh, we could totally make a web2.0 icon for E2 ...

(2007-08-18 14:21:15) <Two_Sheds_2> I agree, spiregrain, but I think that it might take a lot of work just to understand what's there.

(2007-08-18 14:21:20) <AndrewAguecheek> WP even if they did, would people vote for it?

(2007-08-18 14:21:20) <Two_Sheds_2> More than $250 worth.

(2007-08-18 14:21:37) <Wiccanpiper> ha, AA, I hope not!

(2007-08-18 14:21:43) <Two_Sheds_2> Maybe, dann. I haven't played with that code. It's by [kthejoker] and [ascorbic].

(2007-08-18 14:22:06) <dann> two: good to know - I'll brin it up with them, then

(2007-08-18 14:22:12) <LordBrawl> That would really help, I think

(2007-08-18 14:22:18) <spiregrain> even if there was a separate previews page, that'd be swell

(2007-08-18 14:22:21) <LordBrawl> I don't want to click every bloody link

(2007-08-18 14:22:26) <Wiccanpiper> If we allow an outsider to use their winning theme as part of promoting themselves, that might be worth more than the $250?

(2007-08-18 14:22:33) <spiregrain> most of them are a bit rickety anyway

(2007-08-18 14:22:34) <LordBrawl> Especially when I do so and 60% are blue and gray!

(2007-08-18 14:22:48) <Two_Sheds_2> When I do web design I spend a lot of time talking to clients about what functions they want different elements to have. That's the piece I think might make an outsider's work difficult.

(2007-08-18 14:22:52) <eien_meru> "I skinned a site from the 90's into the future" would look nice.

(2007-08-18 14:22:56) <spiregrain> some of them have cool rounded corners and stuff

(2007-08-18 14:23:13) <AndrewAguecheek> WP that would also promote e2 to a certain extent, which might be a good reason to do that anyway.

(2007-08-18 14:23:20) <cletus> i think what we need is more spinning pentagram gifs

(2007-08-18 14:23:21) <LordBrawl> (of course I'm blue/green colourblind)

(2007-08-18 14:23:35) <spiregrain> (spinning pentagram gifs)++

(2007-08-18 14:23:41) <LordBrawl> IS there one up there now that's really wow! ?

(2007-08-18 14:23:51) <Wiccanpiper> Hey! I see enough spinning pentagrams as it is

(2007-08-18 14:24:15) <spiregrain> brumlove is probably the most !!!

(2007-08-18 14:24:25) <Gorgonzola> 3:30's going to be my limit, kids

(2007-08-18 14:24:40) <dann> I've been using kernel blue, per suggestion of TwoSheds. It's not that bad, but doesn't scale well (when I have to apple-plus to increase the font size, that is)

(2007-08-18 14:24:53) <eien_meru> Kernel Blue is nice.

(2007-08-18 14:25:22) <dann> OK. we've got a few places to improve the theme quest

(2007-08-18 14:25:40) <spiregrain> brumlove has jukka colours, but diagonal pinstripes, rounded corners . . . and notelets on the left!

(2007-08-18 14:25:54) <eien_meru> It's also disgusting.

(2007-08-18 14:26:10) <AndrewAguecheek> notelets on the left? Heresy!

(2007-08-18 14:26:20) <dann> Since Gorgonzola has to leave soon, let's handle number 5 next - an appropriate forum in which to handle user-locking

(2007-08-18 14:26:31) <dann> Gorgonzola: you want to take this one?

(2007-08-18 14:26:54) =-= spiregrain has changed the topic to "1) Fit and function of IRC for our discussion medium; 2) The theme quest publicity; 3) Terms of service; 4) Timing of and technology for next meeting; ** 5) Forum for issues with users **"

(2007-08-18 14:27:13) <spiregrain> e_m - that too!

(2007-08-18 14:27:45) <cletus> sorry, what's this item about? borging, banning, suchlike?

(2007-08-18 14:27:47) <LordBrawl> Can we have a problem statement?

(2007-08-18 14:27:56) <Gorgonzola> Well, I'd like to suggest that when we have *real* problems with a particular user

(2007-08-18 14:28:38) <Gorgonzola> that consequences stay in the Gods group, or ideally with just Blockstackers

(2007-08-18 14:28:57) <anthropod2> Why?

(2007-08-18 14:29:10) <cletus> what does "consequences" mean?

(2007-08-18 14:29:24) <spiregrain> Gorgo - in a nutshell, just because there is an editors group doesn't mean that editors are the right people to deal?

(2007-08-18 14:29:25) <dann> I think my main issue with keeping it within blockstackers is this: none of them is involved socially in E2 any longer. None of them, in fact, are here in this meeitng

(2007-08-18 14:29:33) <Two_Sheds> I think it's a connection problem, spiregrain.

(2007-08-18 14:30:08) <dann> (BSI is [Nate], [Hemos], [Kurt], and [CmdrTaco|Malda] -- only one of whom is still involved in the site )

(2007-08-18 14:30:12) <eien_meru> I think we could reduce the net drama by letting the Gods deal with bannings and such.

(2007-08-18 14:30:14) <spiregrain> If someone said that C-Es job is *not* to handle persistently abusing noders, but it was in the lap of e2 gods, that'd be find by me

(2007-08-18 14:30:47) <AndrewAguecheek> Whilst that seems like a fair point, Blockstackers may have something of a shadowy cabal feel to it. There should probably some democratic element.

(2007-08-18 14:30:48) <Gorgonzola> Well, we recently had an issue where the protracted C_E discussion of someone's banishment caused some bad side effects.

(2007-08-18 14:30:53) <LordBrawl> CEs should refer problems to Jack, that's what the job is for

(2007-08-18 14:30:59) <spiregrain> but C-E's would still have opinions about it, but they'd realise that like Renaming Writeups, it was none of their business

(2007-08-18 14:31:03) <LordBrawl> He can take it forward or handle it as needs be

(2007-08-18 14:31:15) <anthropod2> the lord is right, I think.

(2007-08-18 14:31:20) <LordBrawl> "It Worked For Me" (tm)

(2007-08-18 14:31:25) <eien_meru> Agreed.

(2007-08-18 14:31:28) <Gorgonzola> I think spregrain's characterization is right on the mark

(2007-08-18 14:31:33) <dann> I'm not going to pretend we're not talking about my previous discussions regarding amnesiac - but I will contend that those dealt more with "why should we ban?" than "should we ban him", at least in retrospect.

(2007-08-18 14:32:09) <Gorgonzola> OK guys that's my 2 kopecks' worth

(2007-08-18 14:32:22) <DEB> Bye Gorgo!

(2007-08-18 14:32:23) <eien_meru> Bye, mate.

(2007-08-18 14:32:27) <cletus> bye gorg

(2007-08-18 14:32:30) <Wiccanpiper> One moment, all, and I should've asked earlier - is anyone beside me logging this, in case I get bounced for any reason?

(2007-08-18 14:32:30) <AndrewAguecheek> Bye Gorg

(2007-08-18 14:32:35) <Dimview> Bye, Gorgo

(2007-08-18 14:32:36) <Wiccanpiper> bye Gorgo!

(2007-08-18 14:32:37) <spiregrain> I've never had a problem with the idea that e2 belongs to BSI and is run by those BSI empower. I have certain powers, but that gives me no general rights beyond that

(2007-08-18 14:32:39) <-- Gorgonzola has left irc.slashnet.org (Quit: Leaving)

(2007-08-18 14:32:41) <eien_meru> Wiccanpiper: I am.

(2007-08-18 14:32:42) <dann> I wouldn't have any issue restricting actual bannings to gods-only. Discussing the topic of bannings, however, should involve everyone's input on staff.

(2007-08-18 14:33:00) <dann> Wiccanpiper: I'm also logging it

(2007-08-18 14:33:01) <cletus> i am of two minds about this

(2007-08-18 14:33:06) <Wiccanpiper> Cool!

(2007-08-18 14:33:21) <LordBrawl> I think that protracted discussion leads to dispute and inaction

(2007-08-18 14:33:31) <spiregrain> I agree with LB

(2007-08-18 14:33:33) <eien_meru> I was about to say something similar to what LB said.

(2007-08-18 14:33:35) <LordBrawl> Whereas, when I had to do it and just did it, it almost never caused any ripples

(2007-08-18 14:33:38) <cletus> on the one hand, i agree it ought to be something the executive staff has some input into

(2007-08-18 14:33:46) <AndrewAguecheek> Lack of discussion leads to a certain amount of FUD

(2007-08-18 14:33:57) <eien_meru> And FUD leads to drama.

(2007-08-18 14:34:02) <Wiccanpiper> Speakin' as a former C_E, it's nice for eds to be involved as much as possible in things -- makes the transition to @hood nicer.

(2007-08-18 14:34:07) <cletus> on the other hand, i do kind of like it to be a quiet affair, or at least one that can be done at a stroke

(2007-08-18 14:34:07) <eien_meru> Especially around the anti-establishment folks.

(2007-08-18 14:34:15) <LordBrawl> Even when I did lock [Amnesiac], after his own private request to me, it caused almost no fuss. I ed log'd it right after, and it was calm

(2007-08-18 14:34:40) <Wiccanpiper> LB - protracted debate can be a problem, but dann/Jack can always call a halt to it . . .

(2007-08-18 14:34:50) <spiregrain> think of all the cool writeups the godmins and C_Es could have written instead of the mighty tracts in [The future of amnesiac]

(2007-08-18 14:34:55) <DEB> Or it could be given a time limit.

(2007-08-18 14:35:16) <eien_meru> spiregrain: come on, C_Es don't write writeups.

(2007-08-18 14:35:19) * LordBrawl observes that we're still talking, and nothing has happened yet

(2007-08-18 14:35:54) <spiregrain> the idea we had last time there was an protracted argument was that Jack should read the discussion, but then Just Do It (Where "It" was whatever he alone decided)

(2007-08-18 14:36:00) <LordBrawl> Though as far as I know the subject himself has gone to ground

(2007-08-18 14:36:02) <Two_Sheds> I think that the results of swift action might be less bad than we fear.

(2007-08-18 14:36:08) <dann> There are two paths forward, in my mind:

(2007-08-18 14:36:12) <spiregrain> e_m - well, we bloody well should

(2007-08-18 14:36:22) <cletus> [apatrix] chided me for my heavy hand on this issue, but i really do think that it should be something that all e2gods can do, and only e2gods can do, and they can sort out the regulatory/disciplinary questions amongst themselves

(2007-08-18 14:36:23) <spiregrain> e_m - I think that should be a requirement

(2007-08-18 14:36:36) <eien_meru> spiregrain: I was joking.

(2007-08-18 14:36:45) <AndrewAguecheek> I would be in favour of some quick procedure, but I do think there should be a procedure.

(2007-08-18 14:37:03) <dann> The first involves discussing our third point here, coming up with a consensus on terms of use, and enforcing them when violated in the future

(2007-08-18 14:37:25) <spiregrain> e_m- yeah, I know, but really, if you haven't contributed a non-log writeup for 90 days you should be out on your ear.

(2007-08-18 14:37:34) <spiregrain> anyway, that's off topic

(2007-08-18 14:37:37) <cletus> yes, the procedure for doing it, and the conditions for doing it, are two questions

(2007-08-18 14:37:54) <dann> the second path involves one of the e2gods who had a deal with him taking action against [amnesiac|him] for violating that deal

(2007-08-18 14:37:58) <dann> both are valid, in my mind

(2007-08-18 14:38:24) <Wiccanpiper> Well, I stand by what I said: everyone grows up knowing certain (unwritten) rules for behaving, and when those are violated (and we know that when we see it), I think action's called for, TOS or no TOS.

(2007-08-18 14:38:49) <dann> I completely agree with cletus here - all gods should be able to lock. My only contention is that I'd like to see those rules published somewhere.

(2007-08-18 14:38:56) * Wiccanpiper is exercising his aged status to be grumpy

(2007-08-18 14:39:10) <Dimview> Wiccan++

(2007-08-18 14:39:14) <eien_meru> Wiccanpiper: The problem is we get situations like the current one when action is called for only when it targets someone with a name.

(2007-08-18 14:39:19) <AndrewAguecheek> The problem with having written rules is that grey areas develop very quickly

(2007-08-18 14:39:24) <dann> My "first draft" of the rules I published in the second discussion node: copyright infringement, libel, slander, spamming, hacking, hate speech, and abuse of secondary accounts.

(2007-08-18 14:39:26) <AndrewAguecheek> Some people like to dance on the edge of the cliff.

(2007-08-18 14:39:29) <eien_meru> Without a TOS, it seems arbitrary.

(2007-08-18 14:39:34) <cletus> the kids today, skating their boards on city hall steps. it's an outrage!

(2007-08-18 14:39:39) <dann> Andrew: I agree - it will always evolve into a judgment call.

(2007-08-18 14:39:40) * Wiccanpiper launches into a coughing fit to give the meeting realism

(2007-08-18 14:39:48) <spiregrain> skateboarding ain't' a crime, dude

(2007-08-18 14:39:52) <LordBrawl> I don't think it's arbitrary, because we so seldom do it

(2007-08-18 14:39:56) <cletus> okay, are we segueing to item #3 now?

(2007-08-18 14:40:01) <dann> cletus: I believe so.

(2007-08-18 14:40:04) <eien_meru> spiregrain: Yeah, but putting those damn stickers on your locker is.

(2007-08-18 14:40:17) <LordBrawl> This particular case is difficult because we don't agree amongst ourselves if it's over the line

(2007-08-18 14:40:28) <spiregrain> LB - that doesn't matter

(2007-08-18 14:40:35) <spiregrain> Jack can act as he sees fit

(2007-08-18 14:40:55) <anthropod2> I don't understand what abuse of secondary accounts is, exactly.

(2007-08-18 14:40:58) <spiregrain> he's read the Discussion, and it's for him to act or not

(2007-08-18 14:41:06) <LordBrawl> I still claim that my "[Editor Log: June 2006]" on "locking accounts" is sufficient

(2007-08-18 14:41:13) <cletus> spiregrain, shall we revise the topic, then?

(2007-08-18 14:41:17) <dann> LB: either (a) that doesn't matter because you (plural, Jack included) had a deal with him which was broken, or (b) it's undefined, as we haven't yet drawn a line

(2007-08-18 14:41:27) <spiregrain>"1) Fit and function of IRC for our discussion medium; 2) The theme quest publicity; **3) Terms of service;** 4) Timing of and technology for next meeting; 5) Forum for issues with users"

(2007-08-18 14:41:44) <spiregrain> the deal with him was/is the line

(2007-08-18 14:41:56) =-= spiregrain has changed the topic to "1) Fit and function of IRC for our discussion medium; 2) The theme quest publicity; **3) Terms of service;** 4) Timing of and technology for next meeting; 5) Forum for issues with users"

(2007-08-18 14:42:16) <cletus> as for TOS

(2007-08-18 14:42:20) <cletus> i am a firm believer in common law

(2007-08-18 14:42:35) <dann> anthro: abuse of second accounts hasn't happened in a long time -- it typically involves one person leveling a few accounts to get votes, so each account can upvote / ching the other accounts of the same person. I don't think I've seen that here in four or five years

(2007-08-18 14:42:53) * LordBrawl agrees

(2007-08-18 14:42:55) <AndrewAguecheek> Part of the issue with giving the power to lock to all gods is that some will, rightly or wrongly, be more heavy-handed than others and the system won't average it out.

(2007-08-18 14:42:55) <cletus> if you know the precedent, then you know the law

(2007-08-18 14:43:10) <anthropod2> Right okay, if that's all it is, fine, I agree.

(2007-08-18 14:43:27) <Wiccanpiper> I agree with AA. If I thought someone needed locking, I'd pass it on to Jack or dann.

(2007-08-18 14:43:33) <LordBrawl> AA: yes, but so long as Jack/dann etc. can see these actions in Security Monitor it can be reviewed

(2007-08-18 14:43:48) <dann> LB - spot-on.

(2007-08-18 14:43:59) <cletus> yep

(2007-08-18 14:44:02) <AndrewAguecheek> LB, by then the damage may already be done though.

(2007-08-18 14:44:05) <LordBrawl> Seldom do we need a fast lock. Forbidance suffices to control most damage

(2007-08-18 14:44:15) <AndrewAguecheek> Good point

(2007-08-18 14:44:17) <cletus> in the past when there was a problem with heavy-handedness (that, ahem, wasn't ryan), we dealt with it amongst ourselves quietly

(2007-08-18 14:44:34) <LordBrawl> And if someone's really over the top abusive, there's room bounce

(2007-08-18 14:44:45) <LordBrawl> or the borg clinic

(2007-08-18 14:44:50) <AndrewAguecheek> cletus, it caused resentment amongst the userbase - quiet resolution wasn't appreciated at the time by a lot of people.

(2007-08-18 14:45:11) <LordBrawl> In the old days I used to borg a*holes from Valhalla, so the EDB message wasn't seen. Really removed the drama

(2007-08-18 14:45:13) <cletus> i understand. sometimes doing things that allow resentment is the lesser of two evils

(2007-08-18 14:45:37) <spiregrain> I am in favour of precedent in the actual real laws of the land - but e2 ought to have something like "Don't do hate speech, strong personal abuse, have secondary accounts . . . - and if you do, you'll be dealt with at our discretion, including account locks and banns". Then our discretion is informed by precedent.

(2007-08-18 14:45:38) <dann> I don't remember who recommended it (it's probably in one of the two discussion-sagas), but I think it would be a good idea to maintain a public roster of who's been locked, and why

(2007-08-18 14:45:40) <AndrewAguecheek> possibly, but it can have longterm effects.

(2007-08-18 14:45:58) <cletus> i do believe in making e2gods accountable for borging and banning, to the other e2gods and to jack & dann

(2007-08-18 14:46:13) <LordBrawl> I reported any account locks in my Ed logs, with reasoning

(2007-08-18 14:46:22) <cletus> AA, so can the alternatives

(2007-08-18 14:46:32) <LordBrawl> Exception: New Level 1 commercials, etc. Since nobody should care

(2007-08-18 14:46:34) <Wiccanpiper> Resentment? At some point people *have* to understand being an a**hole has consequences. So often resentment has meant "you whacked my little friend" and I'm pissed.

(2007-08-18 14:47:10) <AndrewAguecheek> Wiccan, yes, but people don't always agree as to what exactly is being an a**hole - hence the need for TOS though I suppose.

(2007-08-18 14:47:11) <cletus> the only one who ever confronted me with their resentment did so in a way inappropriate manner, that suggested he would have been impossible to please anyway

(2007-08-18 14:47:15) <dann> LB - certainly. I think there would be a point to having a centralized blotter, though. This way the already documented precedent is accessible in one place

(2007-08-18 14:47:24) <Wiccanpiper> AA: true that.

(2007-08-18 14:47:27) <AndrewAguecheek> cletus, a lot of people left the site quietly instead

(2007-08-18 14:47:37) <cletus> i remember, i was there

(2007-08-18 14:47:38) <XWiz> I must say, next time the problem arises why can't people say 'Well, [Amnesiac] gets away with it . . . '; we need consistency above all.

(2007-08-18 14:47:58) <AndrewAguecheek> LB that sounds like a good plan.

(2007-08-18 14:48:26) <spiregrain> the trouble with ed logs is that all the good content in them is hard to search

(2007-08-18 14:48:40) <spiregrain> for

(2007-08-18 14:48:48) <Wiccanpiper> Y'all, [Amnesiac] was sort of an extreme case -- his antics aren't leading us to a harder line than we need, are they?

(2007-08-18 14:48:51) <LordBrawl> "Security Monitor" shows locks and unlocks already

(2007-08-18 14:49:11) <eien_meru> Wiccanpiper: They probably are. I still agree with Jack's observation in the second discussion.

(2007-08-18 14:49:12) <LordBrawl> Someone used to index the ed logs . . .

(2007-08-18 14:49:14) <cletus> a public list could have who was banned and why, but perhaps not by whom; that is something that should be known to the e2gods, and that they ought all be prepared to explain and defend

(2007-08-18 14:49:29) <cletus> ditto for a borg blotter, maybe

(2007-08-18 14:49:31) <eien_meru> LordBrawl: It wouldn't be terribly difficult to reindex them.

(2007-08-18 14:49:31) <XWiz> He's also a kind of benchmark. I can say anything, up to and including the recent controversial phrase.

(2007-08-18 14:49:39) <Wiccanpiper> cletus: yes, that'd help with the transparency thing!

(2007-08-18 14:49:58) -->Heisenberg_e2 (Heisenberg@cloak-A4C79228.dip.t-dialin.net) has joined #everything2

(2007-08-18 14:50:00) <dann> cletus: indeed.

(2007-08-18 14:50:10) <Heisenberg_e2> evening. sorry to be late.

(2007-08-18 14:50:10) <AndrewAguecheek> a public list with all e2gods taking cabinet responsibility would work I think.

(2007-08-18 14:50:13) <DEB> Welcome, Heisy.

(2007-08-18 14:50:14) <spiregrain> hihi heisenberg!

(2007-08-18 14:50:19) <AndrewAguecheek> Hi Heis

(2007-08-18 14:50:25) *Dimview waves to Heisy.

(2007-08-18 14:50:26) <LordBrawl> "[Everything Editor Logs]" by gnarl

(2007-08-18 14:50:28) <dann> howdy, Heisenberg

(2007-08-18 14:50:45) <Heisenberg_e2> I'm at my inlaws in Germany and only now managed to sneak to use their horrible windows machine.

(2007-08-18 14:51:00) <Heisenberg_e2> DIALUP!!!!

(2007-08-18 14:51:03) <Wiccanpiper> Heisy!

(2007-08-18 14:51:27) <cletus> okay, so if we have a ban registry and a borg blotter, then users can know the precedents.

(2007-08-18 14:51:35) <dann> So, is concensus that our TOS will be represented by the precedent expressed in this lock-log?

(2007-08-18 14:51:53) <cletus> do we need to cover anything else with an explicit TOS?

(2007-08-18 14:52:05) <LordBrawl> Again I plug my ed log, perhaps rewritten

(2007-08-18 14:52:07) <AndrewAguecheek> cletus, and anyone who feels they were treated unfairly will at least be able to see the reasons given, and offer a defence.

(2007-08-18 14:52:21) <LordBrawl> if not for that, than as a guideline for staff

(2007-08-18 14:52:24) <cletus> yes, i'd support that, AA

(2007-08-18 14:52:59) <dann> That sounds good to me.

(2007-08-18 14:53:04) <cletus> if anything should go in a proper TOS, it's copyright rules

(2007-08-18 14:53:06) <AndrewAguecheek> hm. A basic TOS might still be a good idea, he precedents will serve to interpret it.

(2007-08-18 14:53:15) <spiregrain> cletus -explicit TOS is just that list above "No spam, persistent personal abuse, secondary accounts, plagarism . . . " etc, keep it simple

(2007-08-18 14:53:20) <AndrewAguecheek> Yes.

(2007-08-18 14:53:26) <cletus> yes yes

(2007-08-18 14:53:31) <eien_meru> Yes.

(2007-08-18 14:53:38) <spiregrain> AA - are you a lawyer by any chance?

(2007-08-18 14:53:45) <Heisenberg_e2> sounds sensible.

(2007-08-18 14:53:47) <AndrewAguecheek> that's AA LLB to you ;-)

(2007-08-18 14:53:51) <DEB> That's all that's needed. Essentially an expression of what Wiccanpiper refers to as basic social norms.

(2007-08-18 14:54:02) <Dimview> Seems sensible.

(2007-08-18 14:54:12) <dann> I can integrate my simple list into the FAQ (with some examples) as the TOS, if we think that can work sustainably.

(2007-08-18 14:54:31) <Wiccanpiper> Would someone quickly recap for Heisy's benefit?

(2007-08-18 14:54:56) <dann> That's all I have on the agenda for this meeting. Does anyone else have a topic we should cover as a group?

(2007-08-18 14:55:03) <spiregrain> "copyright infringement, libel, slander, spamming, hacking, hate speech, and abuse of secondary accounts." - but I'd say it needs qualifiers like "persistent", "knowing", "serious" or something

(2007-08-18 14:55:05) <cletus> wow, we're almost done with the agenda. i had doubts, but this is a really fruitful way of doing this.

(2007-08-18 14:55:18) <Wiccanpiper> YES, please, #4

(2007-08-18 14:55:23) <LordBrawl> when and how to meet again

(2007-08-18 14:55:27) <LordBrawl> oops, jinx

(2007-08-18 14:55:37) <Wiccanpiper> Trying to schedule this was, well, trying

(2007-08-18 14:55:37) <dann> Ahh yes. I thought we rolled #4 into #1.

(2007-08-18 14:55:41) =-= spiregrain has changed the topic to "1) Fit and function of IRC for our discussion medium; 2) The theme quest publicity; 3) Terms of service;** 4) Timing of and technology for next meeting;** 5) Forum for issues with users"

(2007-08-18 14:56:00) <Wiccanpiper> I've had to promise locally-grown bacon to Jack!

(2007-08-18 14:56:04) <dann> I think we should keep these as-needed. I'm not a fan of meetings without plans and agendas

(2007-08-18 14:56:14) * LordBrawl concurs

(2007-08-18 14:56:17) *cletus concurs

(2007-08-18 14:56:18) <DEB> I think that for 12-15 of this, the medium is acceptable. For more, it could perhaps prove tricky. Assuming of course that we have more attendees.

(2007-08-18 14:56:29) <Wiccanpiper> agreed, dann, when we accumulate say, three or more agenda items?

(2007-08-18 14:56:33) <dann> in fact, with the amount of productivity we've had here so far, I'd be surprised if we needed them more than once every month or three

(2007-08-18 14:56:34) <spiregrain> two thoughts on that - this started at 8pm for me which is great. so I don't mind being slightly inconvenienced next time

(2007-08-18 14:57:01) <XWiz> I'll happily try to fit in with everyone else.

(2007-08-18 14:57:03) <dann> This time works fine for me - just about any time on weekends will.

(2007-08-18 14:57:07) <Wiccanpiper> I'll volunteer to keep organizing them . . .

(2007-08-18 14:57:12) <cletus> my schedule's pretty much wide open. ah grad student life.

(2007-08-18 14:57:17) <Heisenberg_e2> Ahem.

(2007-08-18 14:57:18) <Dimview> I will make time for meetings. No problem.

(2007-08-18 14:57:21) <Wiccanpiper> and next one, I'll give more lead time and announcements

(2007-08-18 14:57:22) <spiregrain> it is way better than CE Discussions for certain things

(2007-08-18 14:57:22) <dann> Wiccanpiper: that helps immensely, please to keep organizing them

(2007-08-18 14:57:59) <AndrewAguecheek> Can we have someone to submit agenda items to? If enough people raise an issue, then it'd be an indication a meeting is worthwhile.

(2007-08-18 14:58:00) <spiregrain> ACTIONS: spiregrain and wiccanpiper to writeup something about the best ways to get into IRC for eds and godmins

(2007-08-18 14:58:17) <Heisenberg_e2> this would mean 7 am on the weekend for me, but I can always use my macbook in bed.

(2007-08-18 14:58:29) <dann> Andrew: yes - please send agenda items to me

(2007-08-18 14:58:39) <Two_Sheds> I think having open community fora as similar discussion is still a good idea.

(2007-08-18 14:58:44) <spiregrain> ACTIONS: all to send agenda items to dann

(2007-08-18 14:59:01) <Heisenberg_e2> could somebody send me the log of todays discussions?

(2007-08-18 14:59:11) <Wiccanpiper> One last thing: shall I publish this log as a superdoc?

(2007-08-18 14:59:11) <Two_Sheds> But we might need a separate channel for asking to speak next if there are a lot of people.

(2007-08-18 14:59:20) <Heisenberg_e2> ah.

(2007-08-18 14:59:24) <dann> ACTIONS: Dann to put together borg blotter and lock ledger, forum for feedback, TOS in FAQ

(2007-08-18 14:59:39) <AndrewAguecheek> Wiccan, yes, but gods/editors only?

(2007-08-18 14:59:41) <dann> Wiccanpiper: publish it as an oppressor_superdoc (eds/gods only)

(2007-08-18 14:59:51) <Wiccanpiper> I AM TEH OPPRESSOR

(2007-08-18 14:59:58) <eien_meru> Oh dear.

(2007-08-18 15:00:02) <dann> *smiles*

(2007-08-18 15:00:04) * DEB cowers

(2007-08-18 15:00:10) * Dimview bows.

(2007-08-18 15:00:22) <Wiccanpiper> I'll put the ACTIONS as a separate part at the end of the log, for ease of viewing

(2007-08-18 15:00:29) <dann> Thanks, Joe.

(2007-08-18 15:00:44) * Wiccanpiper oppresses eien_meru

(2007-08-18 15:01:01) <eien_meru> On that note, I need to go meet my parental units for lunch.

(2007-08-18 15:01:02) <spiregrain> right, are we done with the chat?

(2007-08-18 15:01:04) <dann> Thank you, everyone for showing up today. This meeting has exceeded my expectations.

(2007-08-18 15:01:07) <eien_meru> Thanks for a productive meeting, everyone.

(2007-08-18 15:01:08) <dann> I think we're done, yes

(2007-08-18 15:01:10) <spiregrain> where's the after party?

(2007-08-18 15:01:14) <Wiccanpiper> And thanks to everyone who helped set it up!

(2007-08-18 15:01:16) <cletus> thanks a lot, everyone!

ACTION ITEMS

  • [spiregrain] and [wiccanpiper] to writeup something about the best ways to get into IRC for eds and godmins.
  • Anyone having agenda items for the next meeting should send them to [dann].
  • [dann] to put together a borg blotter and lock ledger, a forum for feedback, and a Terms Of Service in the FAQ.
node.title: Chat Transcript: E2 Online Admin Meeting 18Aug07
